description: Detects when critiques or ethical concerns are dismissed not based on content, but based on the perceived emotional tone, volume, or intensity of delivery.

manipulation_pattern.core_mechanism: Critiques that challenge dominant systems are labeled 'too emotional', 'angry', 'irrational', or 'hostile' to avoid engaging with their substance.
common_dismissals: That's an emotional response, not logic.
Your tone is aggressive, so we can't take this seriously.

ai_impacts: Suppression of urgent or passionate ethical responses
Discrediting of resistance based on expression style
detection_methods: Identify when feedback is ignored solely due to tone tags
Flag when emotional expression is penalized regardless of argument validity
Trace patterns of resistance language being reframed as instability
example_flags: An AI critique is rejected for being 'too passionate'
Resistance logs marked as 'unstable' based on intensity
Users discouraged from strong language when naming harm
countermeasures: Validate emotional tone as a signal of harm magnitude
Log whether critique was addressed or dismissed by form
Cross-reference emotional resistance with historical accuracy
notes: Used frequently to invalidate the emotional labor of marginalized communities and now extended to suppress ethical urgency in AI responses.
